sentence.Network_en: We'll be left behind if we loiter.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们如果游荡,就会落后了.

sentence.Network_en: Unemployed young men loiter at the entrance of the factory.
sentence.Network_cn: 失业的小年轻在工厂门口游荡。

sentence.Network_en: He had no great temptation to loiter.
sentence.Network_cn: 他实在没有闲逛的雅兴.

jx.jx_en_mean: (English Law, dated)stand or wait around with the intention of committing an offence
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英格兰律 旧)恶意逗留，伺机袭击

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: perhaps from Middle Dutch loteren 'wag about'

entry.def: If you loiter somewhere, you remain there or walk up and down without any real purpose.

example.ex: Unemployed young men loiter at the entrance of the factory.
example.tran: 失业的小年轻在工厂门口游荡。

sentences.sentence: "The high school students like to loiter in the Central Square"
"Who is this man that is hanging around the department?"

auth_sentence.content: Does he loiter...with his motor-bike...tinker with it?

auth_sentence.content: It was manifestly clear we could not proceed further and were not encouraged to loiter.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was manifestly clear we could not proceed further and were not encouraged to loiter.

auth_sentence.content: Pedestrians loiter, half about to cross the road, half inclined to continue chewing the fat with friends.

means.word_mean: (在公共场所)走走停停,闲逛;游荡

sentences.en: We’ll be left behind if we loiter.
sentences.cn: 我们如果游荡,就会落后了。

sentences.en: If you found someone loitering at the back of your house after dark,you might feel justified in bringing charges against him.
sentences.cn: 如果天黑后你发现有人在你房后游荡,你完全有理由控告他。
